text: Most software products begin with an initial software model, one that is typically naive and superficial, grounded in basic understanding.
question: What is common about the starting point of most software products?

text: This initial phase is natural, as it aligns with the early stages of discovering and exploring a new product with stakeholders.
question: Why is the initial phase considered natural in the context of engaging with a new product?

text: Initially, the process involves identifying nouns and verbs to create the first objects and methods in our code.
question: How does the initial process of creating the first objects and methods in code begin?

text: While this early model enables quick feedback for the product, it often becomes less effective over time.
question: Why does this early model become less effective over time?

text: As more feedback is gathered, the model usually fails to accurately reflect the main concerns of domain experts, becoming less relevant for the product's development.
question: Why does the model become less relevant for the product's development over time?

text: The absence of a model that mirrors the domain's core aspects can prevent adjustments to the code based on changing stakeholder needs, potentially blocking product innovations.
question: How can the lack of a relevant model affect the ability to innovate a product?

text: Additionally, the gap between the code and the domain model leads to missed opportunities for insights, as the code no longer represents our domain knowledge accurately.Join us in this live coding talk session focused on the significance of continuously refining your core domain models in code.
question: Why is it important to keep updating your core domain models in the code?

text: By the end, you'll understand how continuously refactoring the model can be pivotal in driving product development breakthroughs.
question: How can continuously refactoring the model impact product development?

text: Understanding that Essent's journey towards becoming fully cloud-native is ongoing, we acknowledge our current reliance on traditional infrastructures, such as EC2 and RDS instances.
question: What traditional infrastructures are still being used as Essent moves towards becoming fully cloud-native?

text: To bridge this gap, Essent has engineered a serverless solution that empowers developers to manage their environments effortlessly through straightforward Slack commands or API’s, accessible via a developer portal.
question: How does Essent's serverless solution help developers manage their environments?

text: This innovation enables Essent engineers to stop or start non-production environments with the same ease as turning off a light switch, marking the end of their workday or starting a new one by reducing cloud waste.
question: How does this innovation benefit Essent engineers in managing non-production environments?

text: Crucially, the cornerstone of this initiative was habit building.
question: What was the fundamental aspect of this initiative?

text: More than the introduction of a new tool, fostering a culture where sustainable practices became second nature was key.
question: Why was fostering a culture of sustainable practices important?

text: Databases are going all-in on AI.We all know that AI is "the" hot new thing.
question: What is the current trend with databases in relation to AI?

text: AI is fast transforming not just the tech world, but our world in general.
question: How is AI changing various aspects of life beyond just technology?

text: Who among us hasn't had a relative, friend, or Uber driver ask us about this in the last year?But what's AI got to do with databases?
question: What is the relationship between AI and databases?

text: As it turns out, quite a lot.
question: What is the extent of what is involved?

text: The right database can help your application, business, or customer get more out of AI, faster.
question: How can the right database enhance the performance of AI applications?

text: What's more, the right database can even make the AI models themselves work better.That's why existing databases are scrambling to support AI use cases, and developers are looking for databases that offer features and deep integration with various AI models, capabilities and power AI-powered applications.This talk will cover all this through the lens of it means for a database to be "AI-native".
question: Why are developers seeking out databases with specific features and deep integration with AI models?

text: AI-native databases are designed to empower builders and developers to build AI-powered tools.We'll talk about how they enable better search, integrate with generative AI models, and improve generative models' capabilities.
question: How do AI-native databases enhance search functionalities?

text: We'll also talk about the key pieces of technology that enable these value-adds, like vector indexes, vector and hybrid search, retrieval augmented generation, and multi-tenancy.
question: What are some critical technologies that help facilitate these additional benefits?

text: Of course, there'll be live demos and examples to round out the talk, too.So join us to learn why an AI-native database should be an integral part of your AI tech stack.
question: Why should an AI-native database be an essential part of your AI technology stack?

text: In today's academic world, the number of scientific papers on any topic is growing.
question: Why is the number of scientific papers on various topics increasing in today's academic world?

text: While this wealth of textual data is a treasure trove for data scientists, it simultaneously presents significant challenges for anyone who wants to screen this literature systematically.
question: What are the challenges for individuals wanting to systematically review a large amount of textual data?

text: Whether for medical guidelines, review papers, or for evidence-based policy recommendations, one needs to systematically sift through thousands of studies to identify the rare relevant ones.
question: Why is it necessary to review many studies to find the relevant ones for medical guidelines or policy recommendations?

text: This tedious, time-consuming, and error-prone process (e.g., due to screening fatigue) usually demands months of work.
question: Why does this process take months of work?

text: Despite this effort, systematic overviews are indispensable for scholars and clinicians, policymakers, journalists, and the public at large.
question: Why are systematic overviews considered essential for various groups like scholars and policymakers?

text: The rapidly evolving field of AI offers promising solutions to the literature screening challenge using machine learning models and, very recently, large language models (LLMs).
question: How is the field of artificial intelligence addressing the challenge of literature screening?

text: However, many of these AI-driven solutions emerge from tech companies that publish new and, hopefully, better models at an unprecedented rate.
question: Where do many AI-driven solutions originate from?

text: The rapidity of advancements in the field of AI outpaces meticulous scientific evaluations, leaving many methods unrefined and unproven.
question: Why are many AI methods still unrefined and unproven?

text: Moreover, we know that the broader scientific community (and beyond) has concerns about using LLMs for research: Should we replace human screeners with an AI (as predicted by OpenAI), or should we keep a human in the loop?
question: What are the concerns about using AI instead of humans for research screening?

text: And, if we want to use an AI, what model is best for maximizing performance and under what conditions?
question: What AI model should we choose to achieve the best performance and under which conditions?

text: How do humans interact with machines, and what types of bias are introduced by these new workflows?At The AI-aided knowledge discovery lab at Utrecht University, we facilitate research to answer such questions and develop fully open and transparent infrastructure to test and apply new models to real-world applications, including the open-source software ASReview (https://github.com/asreview).
question: How does the AI-aided knowledge discovery lab at Utrecht University help in researching human and machine interactions and addressing biases?

text: During the presentation, Rens will present several use cases where comprehensive literature overviews are essential (think of medical guidelines, side-effects of drugs, and dosage recommendations for children).
question: What are some scenarios where detailed literature reviews are important?

text: He will show how machine learning models can accelerate the screening task, and then we will discuss whether AI can fully replace humans for this task…p.s., Become a stargazer of the ASReview project and help us to increase visibility!
question: How can machine learning models speed up the screening process?
